Articles.Content:
Hi all,

I recently completed a class on aircraft/spacecraft stability. I'm by no means an expert on the subject, but I was wondering how accurate KSP is?

For example, when designing a spaceplane, I would choose to place the wings above the center of gravity to increase stability. I would also choose to place the center of lift about 1/3 away from the leading edge of the wings.

The list of design guidelines for aircraft and spacecraft is very long, so my general question is: How accurate are the dynamics in KSP? What (if any) phenomena are known to not be in the game?

Thanks!
not at all, KSP's plane dynamics are in no way realistic.
Regarding that, I've noticed some huge problems with the SAS stuff. (unstable wiggling, won't hold attitude) Any workarounds for that?
Not currently. Romfarer's lasers would probably be the best mod for having stable airplanes that holds altitude. (Plus some extra )
